Type.Name: IRevisionCloud
Type.Description: Allows access to a revision cloud annotation.

Example.Name: Insert Revision Cloud into a Drawing
Insert Revision Cloud into a Drawing
Insert Revision Cloud into a Drawing

Type.Remarks: Remarks To create a revision cloud in a drawing document, call: <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDrawingDoc.InsertRevisionCloud">IDrawingDoc.InsertRevisionCloud</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDrawingDoc.IInsertRevisionCloud">IDrawingDoc.IInsertRevisionCloud</see> . <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRevisionCloud.GetAnnotation">IRevisionCloud.GetAnnotation</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRevisionCloud.IGetAnnotation">IRevisionCloud.IGetAnnotation</see> to get the annotation object for the revision cloud. <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IAnnotation.SetPosition">IAnnotation.SetPosition</see> to set the revision cloud position point on the drawing. If you eliminate this step, the revision cloud is rendered starting at the drawing origin of x=0, y=0, z=0. Set the revision cloud position point as follows: For revision cloud shape... Set the revision cloud position point to... Ellipse The center of the revision cloud. Rectangle A corner of the revision cloud. Polygon One of the points on the revision cloud. Freehand One of the points on the revision cloud. <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRevisionCloud.ArcRadius">IRevisionCloud.ArcRadius</see> to set the arc radius of the revision cloud. <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRevisionCloud.SetPathPointAtIndex">IRevisionCloud.SetPathPointAtIndex</see> one or more times with Index = -1 to create points on the revision cloud as follows: For revision cloud shape... Call IRevisionCloud::SetPathPointAtIndex... Ellipse Once, specifying the coordinates of a corner of the ellipse-inscribed rectangle. Rectangle Once, specifying the coordinates of a corner opposite the revision cloud position point. Polygon (Number of polygon sides + 1) times, such that the first and last points coincide with the revision cloud position point. Freehand Indefinite number of times, such that the first and last points coincide with the revision cloud position point. <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IRevisionCloud.Finalize">IRevisionCloud.Finalize</see> to close the revision cloud path. Once the revision cloud path is closed, you can no longer add points to it. IRevisionCloud::SetPathPointAtIndex to modify the position of an existing point on the revision cloud.

Type.Name: ISMGussetFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a sheet metal gusset feature.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To create a sheet metal gusset feature: Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateDefinition">IFeatureManager.CreateDefinition</see> to instantiate this feature data object. Pre-select faces, lines, edges, vertices, or points as follows: To... Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2</see> to select... Specify the legs of the gusset feature Two flat faces of a bend. - or - Two flat faces adjacent to a cylindrical bend face. - or - One cylindrical bend face. - or - One flat face and one non-planar face adjacent to a toroidal bend. - or - One toroidal bend face. Optionally orient the gusset section plane One linear edge or sketch segment that is perpendicular to the gusset section plane. If you do not pre-select either entity, then the bend line adjacent to the gusset legs is used as the reference. Optionally position the gusset section plane One vertex, sketch point, or reference point. If you do not pre-select any of these entities, then you must set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.UseOffset">ISMGussetFeatureData.UseOffset</see> to true and specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.OffsetDistance">ISMGussetFeatureData.OffsetDistance</see> to define the reference point. For insertion of the first gusset, the assumed reference point is on the end of the sheet metal bend. For second and subsequent gusset insertions, the assumed reference point is on the edge of the gusset last inserted. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.ProfileDimensionScheme">ISMGussetFeatureData.ProfileDimensionScheme</see> and modify other properties on this feature data object as follows: If ISMGussetFeatureData::ProfileDimensionScheme= <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swSheetMetalGussetProfileDimType_e">swSheetMetalGussetProfileDimType_e</see> . swSheetMetalGussetProfileDimType_ProfileDimensions, to dimension the gusset profile using... Specify ISMGussetFeatureData::... Both legs of the gusset <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.ProfileLengthDim">ProfileLengthDim</see> for d1 leg <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.ProfileHeightDim">ProfileHeightDim</see> for d2 leg <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.UseAngleDimForProfile">UseAngleDimForProfile</see> = false <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.FlipDimSides">FlipDimSides</see> = true to swap d1 and d2 legs during dimensioning d1 leg and the angle it forms with the gusset ProfileLengthDim for d1 leg <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMGussetFeatureData.ProfileAngleDim">ProfileAngleDim</see> of angle formed by gusset intersecting d1 leg UseAngleDimForProfile = true FlipDimSides = true to swap d1 and d2 legs during dimensioning d2 leg and the angle it forms with the gusset ProfileHeightDim for d2 leg ProfileAngleDim of angle formed by gusset intersecting d2 leg UseAngleDimForProfile = true FlipDimSides = true to swap d1 and d2 legs during dimensioning Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager.CreateFeature</see> . For more information, see the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Sheet Metal > Using Sheet Metal Tools > Adding Sheet Metal Gussets > Sheet Metal Gusset PropertyManager topic.

Type.Name: ISMNormalCutFeatureData2
Type.Description: Allows access to a sheet metal normal cut feature.
Type.Remarks: Remarks Extruded cuts that pierce models at an angle have non-normal side walls. To make these side walls normal, you create a normal cut feature. To create a normal cut feature: Open a sheet metal part that has a cut-extrude with non-normal side walls. Call IFeatureManager::CreateDefinition(swFmNormalCut) to access this interface. Set non-entity properties on this interface. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByRay">IModelDocExtension.SelectByRay</see> or <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2</see> with Mark = 4 to select the offset plane, only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.NormalCutParameters">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.NormalCutParameters</see> is set to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swNormalCutParameters_e">swNormalCutParameters_e</see> .swNormalCutOffsetPlane. Use IModelDocExtension::SelectByRay or IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with Mark = 8 to select the direction of the normal cut, only if ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::NormalCutParameters is set to swNormalCutParameters_e.swNormalCutExtent. Use IModelDocExtension::SelectByRay or IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with Mark = 1 to select each non-normal face in the group. If <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.AutoPropagation">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.AutoPropagation</see> is set to true, then all faces tangent to a selected face are automatically added to the face group. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.CreateGroup">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.CreateGroup</see> to access <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutGroupData">ISMNormalCutGroupData</see> . Repeat steps 6 and 7 as many times as you have face groups. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDoc2.ClearSelection2">IModelDoc2.ClearSelection2</see> after each face group is created. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager.CreateFeature</see> . To edit a normal cut feature: Call IFeature::GetDefinition to get this feature data object for a selected normal cut feature. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.AccessSelections">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.AccessSelections</see> . Note: Any selections made * before* this call are invalid. To edit the properties of this feature, you must re-select their entities during the editing session, i.e., after calling ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::AccessSelections. (See step 5.) Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.GetGroupNames">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.GetGroupNames</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.GetGroupByName">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.GetGroupByName</see> to access ISMNormalCutGroupData for an existing face group. Call ISMNormalCutFeatureData2::CreateGroup to create another face group if needed. Modify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.CutDirection">cut direction</see> , <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.OffsetPlaneReference">offset plane reference</see> , or other properties on ISMNormalCutFeatureData2 as needed. To select property entities, use IModelDocExtension::SelectByRay or IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 followed by <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISelectionMgr.GetSelectedObject6">ISelectionMgr.GetSelectedObject6</see> . You can also use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IEntity.Select4">IEntity.Select4</see> . Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature.ModifyDefinition</see> if you modifed the feature or <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.ReleaseSelectionAccess">ISMNormalCutFeatureData2.ReleaseSelectionAccess</see> if you did not.

Type.Name: ISWPropertySheet
Type.Description: Allows applications to add pages to certain property sheets that are exported by the SOLIDWORKS Design application.
Type.Remarks: Remarks See <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swPropSheetType_e">swPropSheetType_e</see> for a list of the property sheets that support this functionality. An example of a property sheet is the dialog that is displayed when you click Tools > Options . This dialog consists of a base property sheet and property pages stacked on top of it. To display a specific property page, click its tab. The MFC class that implements a property sheet is CPropertysheet, and the MFC class that implements a property page is CPropertyPage. ISWPropertySheet is a OLE wrapper class over the SOLIDWORKS CPropertysheet class. This means that SOLIDWORKS API programmers can add their own CPropertyPages to a SOLIDWORKS Design property sheet. A SOLIDWORKS Design property sheet is different from an <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPropertyManagerPage2">IPropertyManager</see> page. A PropertyManager page is displayed when the PropertyManager tab is selected on the left-side panel. PropertyManager pages have replaced numerous dialogs. Creating PropertyPages When a property sheet is created that can have pages added to it, the notification swAppPropertySheetCreateNotify is sent via the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks">ISldWorks</see> interface. This notification is sent as swAppPropertySheetCreateNotify( LPDISPATCH sheet, long type) where sheet is the IDispatch interface of a ISWPropertySheet object and type is an enumerated constant of type swPropSheetType_e. When the application receives this notification, it can check the type of the sheet from the type argument. If pages are to be added, then the sequence of operations is: Ensure that the application resources will be used to make the page (for example by calling AfxSetResourceHandle()) Create the CPropertyPage-derived class For 32-bit applications, pass the CPropertyPage object to <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISWPropertySheet.AddPage">ISWPropertySheet.AddPage</see> , casting the CPropertyPage* to a long For 64-bit applications, pass the CPropertyPage object to <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISWPropertySheet.AddPagex64">ISWPropertySheet.AddPagex64</see> , casting the CPropertyPage* to a long long Reset the resources to their previous state Destroying PropertyPages The CPropertyPage PostNcDestroy function is called by the SOLIDWORKS Design application when the property sheet is being destroyed. At this point, the application should delete any objects (for example the CPropertyPage object.) Events are implemented with delegates in the Microsoft .NET Framework. See the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks_namespace">Overview</see> topic for a list of delegates for this interface.

Type.Name: ISafeArrayUtility
Type.Description: Access the ISafeArrayUtility interface, which can: get an unpacked array of native SOLIDWORKS Dispatch-based objects of the same data type and return a packed Variant SafeArray to use in methods that requires passing a packed Variant SafeArray. get a packed Variant SafeArray and return an unpacked array of native SOLIDWORKS Dispatch-based objects of the same data type. get a Variant SafeArray and return the number of SafeArray objects in the Variant SafeArray and their data type. get and put a value in a Variant SafeArray of the same data type.

Example.Name: Get Names of Configurations Using Variant
Get Scale Factor of Each Model View

Type.Remarks: Remarks The ISafeArrayUtility interface replaces the SOLIDWORKS SafeArray template class, which you might have used in earlier versions of SOLIDWORKS to instantiate SafeArrays for methods requiring Variant arrays in your C++ projects. This ISafeArrayUtility interface's methods are only compatible with raw pointers and BSTRs; this interface's methods are not compatible with smart pointers (i.e., reference counted) or the Active Template Library (ATL) class CComBSTR. For example: IDispatch* pDisp1; //This works IDispatchPtr pDisp2 //This does not work CComPtr pDisp3 //This does not work BSTR fileName1 //This works CComBSTR fileName2 //This does not work

Type.Name: IScanto3D
Type.Description: Allows access to Scanto3D point cloud data.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To obtain the data for the entire mesh: Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swscanto3d.IScanto3D.GetMeshCount">IScanto3D.GetMeshCount</see> to get the number of mesh features, n . Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swscanto3d.IScanto3D.GetMeshDataCountAtIndex">IScanto3D.GetMeshDataCountAtIndex</see> iteratively n times to get the number of points and facets in each mesh feature. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swscanto3d.IScanto3D.GetMeshDataAtIndex">IScanto3D.GetMeshDataAtIndex</see> iteratively n times to get the data in each mesh feature.

Type.Name: IScrewMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a screw mate feature.
Type.Remarks: Remarks A screw mate consists of two components, where: Components are concentric. Translation of one component along the axis causes rotation of the other component according to a pitch relationship. Rotation of one component causes translation of the other component. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this mate interface. To create a screw mate: Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IScrewMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">IScrewMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities using Mark = 1. Specify other properties of the ScrewMateFeatureData object. as required. To edit a screw mate: Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature.GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a ScrewMateFeatureData object. Modify the ScrewMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature.ModifyDefinition</see> . To delete this screw mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2</see> .

Type.Description: Allows access to a secondary structure system up-to member that is created between a selected point and one or more primary structure system members or between one or more point-member pairs.
Type.Remarks: Remarks For more information, see the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Secondary Members > Creating Secondary Members with the Up to Members Method topic.

Type.Name: ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a secondary structure system member.
Type.Remarks: Remarks This interface is a superclass of the following interfaces, i.e., you can cast this interface to either of the following: <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryMemberBetweenPointsFeatureData">ISecondaryMemberBetweenPointsFeatureData</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryMemberSupportPlaneFeatureData">ISecondaryMemberSupportPlaneFeatureData</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryMemberUpToMembersFeatureData">ISecondaryMemberUpToMembersFeatureData</see> See the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemFolder">IStructureSystemFolder</see> Remarks.

Example.Name: Selectively and Transparently Section a Section View

Selectively and Transparently Section a Section View

Type.Remarks: Remarks A section view is defined by multiple planes, colors, offsets, etc. To create a section view in a part or assembly: Use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelViewManager.CreateSectionViewData">IModelViewManager.CreateSectionViewData</see> to create the ISectionViewData object. Set the properties of ISectionViewData. Use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelViewManager.CreateSectionView">IModelViewManager.CreateSectionView</see> to create the section view. IModelViewManager::CreateSectionView returns whether it successfully created the section view; it does not return whether it successfully created valid section bodies. Set <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISectionViewData.Redraw">ISectionViewData.Redraw</see> to true to have IModelViewManager::CreateSectionView validate and return a status for section bodies instead of section views.

Type.Description: Allows access to a sheet and objects on the sheet such as BOM tables .

Example.Name: Get Sheet Properties and Insert Object
Activate Each View on Current Sheet
Get Notes from New or Existing Title Block
Get Notes from New or Existing Title Block
Get Notes from New or Existing Title Block

Type.Remarks: Remarks A drawing document can consist of one or more sheets. Each sheet typically contains one or more <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IView">drawing views</see> . Each drawing view is an oriented snapshot of a particular SOLIDWORKS model and a particular <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IConfiguration">configuration</see> of the model.

Type.Name: ISheetMetalFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a sheet metal feature.

Type.Remarks: Remarks To obtain sheet metal feature data from sheet metal models created in SOLIDWORKS 2013 or later, follow the examples of <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.GetTemplateSheetMetal">IModelDocExtension.GetTemplateSheetMetal</see> .

Type.Name: ISheetMetalFolder
Type.Description: Allows access to a sheet metal folder feature in the FeatureManager design tree.
Type.Remarks: Remarks The FeatureManager design tree of a multi-body sheet metal part created in SOLIDWORKS 2013 and later contains a sheet metal folder with multiple sheet metal features. This interface allows access to the sheet metal folder.

Type.Description: Allows access to sheet metal gauge table parameters.

Create Swept Flange Using Gauge Table

Type.Remarks: Remarks For more information about sheet metal gauge tables, read the SOLIDWORKS Help > Sheet Metal > Sheet Metal Parts > Sheet Metal Gauge Tables topic.

Type.Name: IShellFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a shell feature.

Type.Name: IShutOffSurfaceFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a shut-off surface feature.

Type.Description: Allows you to access silhouette edges in drawing documents.

Select Silhouette Edge Attached to Note
Select Silhouette Edge Attached to Note

Type.Name: ISimpleCornerTreatmentFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a simple corner treatment feature of a structure system.
Type.Remarks: Remarks This interface is: derived from <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentFeatureData">ICornerTreatmentFeatureData</see> . valid only if <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentFeatureData.IgnoreCornerTreatment">ICornerTreatmentFeatureData.IgnoreCornerTreatment</see> is false. A simple corner is the position in a structure system where the ends of two members meet either in a body trim or a planar trim fashion. In the SOLIDWORKS Design user interface, the Simple Corner PropertyManager contains two lists that you can manage using the APIs in this interface and elsewhere: <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder.GetCornerTreatments">Corner groups</see> <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleCornerTreatmentFeatureData.UserDefinedTrimFaces">User defined trim</see> faces For more information, see: SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Corner Management > Editing Simple Corners SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Simple Corner PropertyManager

Type.Name: ISimpleFilletFeatureData2
Type.Description: Allows access to a simple fillet feature.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To create a simple fillet feature: Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateDefinition">IFeatureManager.CreateDefinition</see> , passing Type = <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swFeatureNameID_e">swFeatureNameID_e</see> .swFmFillet, to create an instance of ISimpleFilletFeatureData2. Initialize the fillet/chamfer to a simple fillet type as follows: For... Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.Initialize">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.Initialize</see> , passing FilletType = <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swconst.swSimpleFilletType_e">swSimpleFilletType_e</see> ... Constant radius fillet Offset face chamfer swConstRadiusFillet Face fillet Face-face chamfer swFaceFillet Full round fillet swFullRoundFillet Complete the fillet/chamfer type specification by specifying a feature fillet profile type: For... Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile</see> to <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swFeatureFilletProfileType_e">swFeatureFilletProfileType_e</see> .... Constant radius fillet swFeatureFilletCircular (symmetric or asymmetric) swFeatureFilletConicRho (symmetric or asymmetric) swFeatureFilletConicRadius (symmetric) Offset face chamfer swFeatureFilletConicRhoZeroChamfer Face fillet swFeatureFilletCircular (symmetric, asymmetric, chord width, or hold line) swFeatureFilletConicRho (symmetric, asymmetric, or chord width) swFeatureFilletConicRadius (symmetric or chord width) Face-face chamfer swFeatureFilletConicRhoZeroChamfer Full round fillet swFeatureFilletCircular Specify other ISimpleFilletFeatureData2 properties as follows:. To create... You must... Constant radius fillet/offset face chamfer Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2</see> with Mark = 1 to select the edges, faces, features, or loops to fillet. Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.OverflowType">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.OverflowType</see> . (Optional) For both fillets and chamfers, set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.KeepFeatures">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.KeepFeatures</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.PropagateToTangentFaces">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.PropagateToTangentFaces</see> . (Optional) For fillets only, set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.RoundCorners">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.RoundCorners</see> , <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.ConstantWidth">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.ConstantWidth</see> , and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.CurvatureContinuous">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.CurvatureContinuous</see> (if set to true, then ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::RoundCorners and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile are not valid). If a symmetric fillet/chamfer : - For fillets or chamfers, set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.DefaultDistance">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.DefaultRadius</see> to a default fillet radius or chamfer offset distance. - For fillets, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletCircular, then you can set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.IsMultipleRadius">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.IsMultipleRadius</see> . If MultipleRadius is set to true, then you can call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.SetRadius">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.SetRadius</see> to specify multiple edge radii. If ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletConicRho or swFeatureFilletConicRadius, set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.DefaultConicRhoOrRadius">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.DefaultConicRhoOrRadius</see> to a conic rho value between 0.05 and 0.95, inclusive, or a conic radius value, respectively. - For chamfers, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::IsMultipleRadius is set to true, then you can call ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::SetRadius to set multiple offset distances. If an asymmetric fillet/chamfer : - Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.AsymmetricFillet">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.AsymmetricFillet</see> . - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultRadius to the fillet Distance 1 radius or chamfer Offset Distance 1. - Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.DefaultDistance">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.DefaultDistance</see> to the fillet Distance 2 radius or chamfer Offset Distance 2. - For fillets only, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletConicRho, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultConicRhoOrRadius to a conic rho value between 0.05 and 0.95, inclusive. For more information, see the Constant Size Fillets and Chamfer PropertyManager topics in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help. Face fillet/face-face chamfer Call IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with: - Mark = 2 to select Face Set 1. - Mark = 4 to select Face Set 2. (Optional) For both fillets and chamfers, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::PropagateToTangentFaces and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.HelpPoint">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.HelpPoint</see> . (Optional) For fillets only, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous (if set to true, then ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is not valid). If a symmetric fillet/chamfer : - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultRadius for the fillet radius or the chamfer offset distance. - For fillets only, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletConicRho or swFeatureFilletConicRadius, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultConicRhoOrRadius to a conic rho or conic radius value. If a chord width fillet/chamfer : - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultRadius to set the chord width. - For fillets only, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletConicRho or swFeatureFilletConicRadius, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultConicRhoOrRadius to a conic rho or conic radius value. If an asymmetric fillet/chamfer : - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::AsymmetricFillet. - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultRadius to the fillet Distance 1 radius or the chamfer Offset Distance 1. - Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultDistance to the fillet Distance 2 radius or the chamfer Offset Distance 2. - For fillets only, if ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::CurvatureContinuous is false and ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::ConicTypeForCrossSectionProfile is set to swFeatureFilletConicRho, set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::DefaultConicRhoOrRadius to a conic rho value. If a hold line fillet/chamfer : - Call IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with Mark = 8 to select the hold line edges. - Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.HoldLines">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.HoldLines</see> to the hold line edges. For more information, see the Face Fillets and Chamfer PropertyManager topics in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help. Full round fillet Call IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 with: - Mark = 2 to select Face Set 1. - Mark = 512 to select Center Face Set. - Mark = 4 to select Face Set 2. (Optional) Set ISimpleFilletFeatureData2::PropagateToTangentFaces. For more information, see the Full Round Fillets topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help. Setback fillet Follow the instructions above to create a constant radius fillet. Use the setback methods on ISimpleFilletFeatureData2 to set the setback distances from setback vertices of fillet corners. For more information, see the Constant Size Fillets topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help. Partial edge fillet/chamfer Follow the instructions above to create a constant radius fillet or offset face chamfer. Set <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.EnablePartialEdgeParameters">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.EnablePartialEdgeParameters</see> to true. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.GetPartialEdgeFilletData">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.GetPartialEdgeFilletData</see> . Set other properties of IPartialEdgeFilletData as required. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.SetPartialEdgeFilletData">ISimpleFilletFeatureData2.SetPartialEdgeFilletData</see> , passing in the IPartialEdgeFilletData populated in step d. Repeat steps c-e for each edge to partially fillet. For more information, see the Constant Size Fillets and Chamfer PropertyManager topics in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help. Create the fillet/chamfer feature by calling <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager.CreateFeature</see> . For more information about fillets, see the Fillets topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help. See <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/Miscellaneous/Accessing_Selections_that_Define_Features">Accessing Selections that Define Features</see> for additional details.

Type.Remarks: Remarks Motion due to motors supersedes motion due to springs. If you have a motor moving a component to the left and a spring pulling a component to the right, the component moves to the left, and the power consumption of the motor increases.

Type.Name: ISketch
Type.Description: Allows access to sketch entities and to extract information about sketch elements, the sketch orientation, and so on.

Example.Name: Create Imported Surface Body from Sketch
Delete All Constraints in Selected Sketch

Type.Remarks: Remarks A sketch is typically used in <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IPartDoc">part</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc">assembly</see> documents to generate a solid body or such subsequent <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFeature">features</see> as a cut or boss. A sketch is also used in <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDrawingDoc">drawing</see> documents whenever the user constructs individual lines, arcs, and so on, on a drawing <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISheet">sheet</see> or in a drawing <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IView">view</see> .

Create Block Definition and Insert Block Instance

Type.Remarks: Remarks Using this interface, you can: Get and set: Name of the block Whether the block links to a file, and get or set the name of that file Get: All <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchBlockInstance">instances of the block</see> Sketch of this block definition All notes and dimensions and the number of all notes and dimensions See <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Block_Definitions_and_Block_Instances">Block Definitions and Block Instances</see> for details.

Example.Name: Get and Set Blocks Data in Any Document

Type.Remarks: Remarks Using this interface, you can: get the block instance's <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchBlockDefinition">block definition</see> get the sketch in which the block instance is present Get or set the block instance's: Angle Attributes (notes that have tag names and that are not read-only) Layer Leader styles Name Position Scale Text display state Get block instances on a drawing sheet format and edit the sheet format using <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDrawingDoc.EditTemplate">IDrawingDoc.EditTempate</see> and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDoc2.GetActiveSketch2">IModelDoc2.GetActiveSketch2</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDoc2.IGetActiveSketch2">IModelDoc2.IGetActiveSketch2</see> , which gains access to the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketch">sketch</see> that contains the block instances. See <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Block_Definitions_and_Block_Instances">Block Definitions and Block Instances</see> for details.

Type.Name: ISketchPatternFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a sketch-driven pattern feature in a part.

Example.Name: Get Properties of Sketch Pattern Feature
Get Properties of Sketch Pattern Feature
Get Properties of Sketch Pattern Feature

Type.Remarks: Remarks Read <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Pattern_Features_and_their_Feature_Data_Objects">Pattern Features and their Feature Data Objects</see> . Before calling IFeatureManager::CreateDefinition, you must use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities needed to create the circular pattern feature. To select the required entities, use these selection Marks: features = 4 points = 32 sketches = 64 faces = 128 bodies = 256 You must call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager.CreateFeature</see> after initializing this feature data object in order to successfully create a sketch-driven pattern. For more information, see the Sketch Driven Patterns topic in the SOLIDWORKS Help.

Type.Description: Provides access to pictures on sketches (i.e., . bmp , . gif , . jpg , . jpeg , . tif , and . wmf ).

Type.Remarks: Remarks The ISketchPoint object provides access to sketch points while the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchSegment">ISketchSegment</see> object provides access to sketch arcs, lines, ellipses, parabolas, and splines and their corresponding <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchArc">ISketchArc</see> , <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchEllipse">ISketchEllipse</see> , <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchLine">ISketchLine</see> , <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchParabola">ISketchParabola</see> , <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchText">ISketchText</see> , and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchSpline">ISketchSpline</see> interfaces.

Type.Description: Provides access to sketch regions.

Example.Name: Determine If Sketch Contour or Sketch Region

Type.Remarks: Remarks Sketch regions are white space on a sketch bordered by sketch entities or portions of sketch entities basically forming a face. A centerline within a sketch creates sketch regions inside that sketch.

Type.Description: Provides access to the entities for a sketch relation.

Type.Name: ISketchRelationManager
Type.Description: Provides access to all sketch relations.
Type.Remarks: Remarks You can get the associated entities for each sketch relation and vice versa.

Type.Description: Provides access to functions that are common among sketch entities.

Select Chain of Entities Attached to a Sketch Segment
Select Chain of Entities Attached to a Sketch Segment

Type.Remarks: Remarks A SketchSegment can represent a sketch arc, line, ellipse, parabola or spline. ISketchSegment provides functions that are generic to every type of sketch segment. For example, every sketch segment has an ID and can be programmatically selected. Therefore, the ISketchSegment interface provides functions to obtain the ID and to select the item. (For access to sketched points, see the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISketchPoint">ISketchPoint</see> object)

Type.Name: ISldWorks
Type.Description: Provides direct and indirect access to all other interfaces exposed in the SOLIDWORKS API.

Example.Name: Get Names of Creators of Features

Type.Remarks: Remarks This interface is the highest-level object in the SOLIDWORKS API. This interface provides a general set of functions that allow application-level operations such as create, open, close, and quit documents, arrange icons and windows, change the active document, and create attribute definitions. Use CreateObject, GetObject, New, or similar functions to obtain the ISldWorks object from a Dispatch application (Visual Basic or C++ Dispatch). Standalone .exe C++ COM applications can use CoCreateInstance. All of the SOLIDWORKS API add-in wizards automatically create the ISldWorks object for you. Events are implemented with delegates in the Microsoft .NET Framework. See the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks_namespace">Overview</see> topic for a list of delegates for this interface.

Type.Name: ISlicingData
Type.Description: Allows access to slicing tool data.
Type.Remarks: Remarks You must pre-select the first slicing plane before you can access the default bounding box directions for slicing. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.InsertSlicing">IFeatureManager.InsertSlicing</see> takes this data object and invokes the Slicing tool. The Slicing tool creates a parallel or radial series of slicing planes with sketches that intersect, or slice, the model. For more information, see the Slicing Tool topics in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.

Type.Name: ISlotMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a slot mate feature.
Type.Remarks: Remarks A slot mate is a mate between: A bolt and either a straight slot or an arced slot. Two slots, straight or arced <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this mate interface. To create a slot mate: Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISlotMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">ISlotMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities using Mark = 1. Specify other properties of the SlotMateFeatureData object. as required. To edit a slot mate: Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature.GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a SlotMateFeatureData object. Modify the SlotMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature.ModifyDefinition</see> . To delete this slot mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2</see> .

Type.Name: ISmartComponentFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a Smart Component.
Type.Remarks: Remarks A Smart Component is defined by: Components Features Feature references A Smart Component is created in a training assembly. When the Smart Component is saved, it is saved with the training assembly in a SOLIDWORKS part. When the Smart Component is inserted or edited in a target assembly, the training assembly opens in a small preview window, and the PropertyManager page of the Smart Component displays. See the SOLIDWORKS Help for more information about Smart Components. Use... To... This interface Gain access to the training assembly of a Smart Component. Gain access to the selection lists on the PropertyManager page of a Smart Component. Insert features and components into a Smart Component. Delete features and components from a Smart Component. <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IComponent2.GetSmartComponentData">IComponent2.GetSmartComponentData</see> Get the current features, components, and feature references of a Smart Component. <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IComponent2.SetSmartComponentData">IComponent2.SetSmartComponentData</see> Change which features and components to enable in a Smart Component and to insert Smart Features in a target assembly.

Type.Name: ISnapShot
Type.Description: Allows access to the snapshot of the graphics area of an assembly opened in Large Design Review mode.

Example.Name: Open Assembly in Large Design Review Mode
Open Assembly in Large Design Review Mode
Open Assembly in Large Design Review Mode

Type.Remarks: Remarks To open an assembly in Large Design Review mode: Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.GetOpenDocSpec">ISldWorks.GetOpenDocSpec</see> to create an instance of <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDocumentSpecification">IDocumentSpecification</see> . Set <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IDocumentSpecification.ViewOnly">IDocumentSpecification.ViewOnly</see> to true. Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.OpenDoc7">ISldWorks.OpenDoc7</see> , passing it the instance of IDocumentSpecification. - or - Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.OpenDoc6">ISldWorks.OpenDoc6</see> with the Options parameter set to swOpenDocOptions_e.swOpenDocOptions_ViewOnly.

Type.Name: ISplineHandle
Type.Description: Provides access to spline handles.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To enable spline tangency and curvature handles, set <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISldWorks.SetUserPreferenceToggle">ISldWorks.SetUserPreferenceToggle</see> swDisplayAllSplineHandles to True. NOTE: <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISelectionMgr.GetSelectedObjectType3">ISelectionMgr.GetSelectedObjectType3</see> returns swSelMANIPULATORS for a spline handle.

Type.Name: ISplineParamData
Type.Description: Allows access to the parameterization data of a spline.

Type.Name: ISplitBodyFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a Split feature.
Type.Remarks: Remarks <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetTypeName2">IFeature.GetTypeName2</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetTypeName">IFeature.GetTypeName</see> return: Split for a feature that was created by splitting a part into multiple parts by using either <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.PostSplitBody">IFeatureManager.PostSplitBody</see> or the Split feature in the user interface. You can access a split-body feature's data using the ISplitBodyFeatureData interface. SplitBody for a body created by splitting a part and saving the body to a part. You cannot access the data of a split body saved to a part.

Type.Name: IStackedBalloonOptions
Type.Description: Allows access to stacked balloon options.

Example.Name: Insert BOM Table and Stacked Balloon
Insert BOM Table and Stacked Balloon
Insert BOM Table and Stacked Balloon

Type.Remarks: Remarks To create a stack of balloons: Select an item to create the first balloon in the stack. Call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.CreateStackedBalloonOptions">IModelDocExtension.CreateStackedBalloonOptions</see> to create an IStackedBalloonOptions object. Set the properties on the IStackedBalloonOptions object. Pass the IStackedBalloonOptions object in a call to <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.InsertStackedBalloon2">IModelDocExtension.InsertStackedBalloon2</see> . Select one or more items to add to the stack.

Type.Name: IStatusBarPane
Type.Description: Controls user-created status bar panes in the lower-right corner of the SOLIDWORKS status bar.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To use a status bar pane in a project, declare it in your project and manage it during the life cycle of the client application and release just before the client application disconnects from SOLIDWORKS. You can create up to five (5) panes.

Type.Name: IStraightElementData
Type.Description: Allows access to the data of a simple hole element in an Advanced Hole.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To create an Advanced Hole feature, see the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.AdvancedHole">IFeatureManager.AdvancedHole</see> Remarks.

Type.Name: IStraightTapElementData
Type.Description: Allows access to the data of a straight tap hole element in an Advanced Hole.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To create an Advanced Hole feature, see the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.AdvancedHole">IFeatureManager.AdvancedHole</see> Remarks.

Type.Name: IStructuralMemberFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a structural member.

Type.Name: IStructuralMemberGroup
Type.Description: Allows access to a weldment structural-member group.

Type.Name: IStructureSystemFolder
Type.Description: Allows access to a structure system folder.
Type.Remarks: Remarks This interface accesses the top-level folder of a structure system in the FeatureManager design tree. The structure system folder contains one or more profile group folders. Each profile group folder contains profile references and structure system members. When a structure system is created in the user interface, the Corner Management PropertyManager opens automatically. When structure systems are created using the API, a Corner Management X folder is automatically created for each structure system in the FeatureManager design tree. A structure system and its corner management folder appears similar to the following in the FeatureManager design tree. In parentheses are the APIs that you use to access the corresponding item: - Structure System1 (IStructureSystemFolder accessors) - Structure System Grid1 - (1) ( <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IProfileGroupFolder">IProfileGroupFolder</see> accessors) - Plane2 (profile reference plane - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IProfileGroupFolder.GetPlane">IProfileGroupFolder.GetPlane</see> ) - Sketch11 (profile sketch - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IProfileGroupFolder.GetSketch">IProfileGroupFolder.GetSketch</see> ) - Member1 (structure system member - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IProfileGroupFolder.GetStructureSystemMembers">IProfileGroupFolder.GetStructureSystemMembers</see> ) - Corner Management1 ( <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerManagementFolder">ICornerManagementFolder</see> accessors) - Complex Corner Group1 ( <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder">ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder</see> accessors) - Corner5 ( <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerTreatmentFeatureData">ICornerTreatmentFeatureData</see> accessors and then cast to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IComplexCornerTreatmentFeatureData">IComplexCornerTreatmentFeatureData</see> ) - more corners... (Each corner in a complex corner group contains multiple corner members. If you edit a corner to open a Corner Management PropertyManager in the user interface, on the Complex tab are three boxes that list corner members for Trim Tool, Body Trim, and Planar Trim. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ICornerMember">ICornerMember</see> to access these corner members.) - Two member Corner Group1 (ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder accessors) - Corner1 (ICornerTreatmentFeatureData accessors and then cast to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ITwoMemberCornerTreatmentFeatureData">ITwoMemberCornerTreatmentFeatureData</see> ) - more corners... (Each corner in a two member corner group contains two corner members, one for Trim Tool, and one for Body Trim. Use ICornerMember to access these corner members.) - Simple Corner Group1 (ICornerTreatmentGroupFolder accessors) - Corner9 (ICornerTreatmentFeatureData accessors and then cast to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISimpleCornerTreatmentFeatureData">ISimpleCornerTreatmentFeatureData</see> ) - more corners... To create a structure system: Create an <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData</see> object for every primary and secondary structure system member you intend to create. Create <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemSplitMember">IStructureSystemSplitMember</see> objects as needed. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.IsSplit">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.IsSplit</see> to indicate that split members exist. Create one or more <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberProfile">IStructureSystemMemberProfile</see> objects as the number of different profiles is needed. Cast the IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData objects to <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryStructuralMemberFeatureData">IPrimaryStructuralMemberFeatureData</see> objects and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData">ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData</see> objects as needed. Create specific primary member feature data objects by casting IPrimaryStructuralMemberFeatureData objects to: - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryMemberFacePlaneIntersectionFeatureData">IPrimaryMemberFacePlaneIntersectionFeatureData</see> - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryMemberPathSegmentFeatureData">IPrimaryMemberPathSegmentFeatureData</see> - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryMemberPointLengthFeatureData">IPrimaryMemberPointLengthFeatureData</see> - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryMemberRefPlaneFeatureData">IPrimaryMemberRefPlaneFeatureData</see> Create specific secondary member feature data objects by casting ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData objects to: - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryMemberBetweenPointsFeatureData">ISecondaryMemberBetweenPointsFeatureData</see> - <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryMemberSupportPlaneFeatureData">ISecondaryMemberSupportPlaneFeatureData</see> Use the methods and properties on the specific primary and secondary member feature data objects to detail the structure system members. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.CreateStructureSystem">IModelDocExtension.CreateStructureSystem</see> ( primaryFDArray , secondaryFDArray ), where primaryFDArray is an array of primary IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData objects and secondaryFDArray is an array of secondary IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData objects created in step 1. To edit a structure system: Get the structure system folder feature, which is returned by IModelDocExtension::CreateStructureSystem in step 8 above. Then call the accessor of this interface, IFeature::GetSpecificFeature2. (Or call both accessors of this interface.) Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemFolder.GetProfileGroupFolders">IStructureSystemFolder.GetProfileGroupFolders</see> to access the profile group folders in a structure system folder. Use IProfileGroupFolder methods and properties to get the sketch, reference plane, and structure system members in each profile group folder. Use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.StructureSystemMemberType">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.StructureSystemMemberType</see> to determine whether a structure system member retrieved in step 3 is a primary or a secondary member. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.AccessSelections">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.AccessSelections</see> before editing the selections used to create the structure system. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.ReleaseSelectionAccess">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.ReleaseSelectionAccess</see> after editing. Cast IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData objects to their subclass feature data objects (see create steps 5 and 6). If you need to change a structure member's profile, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.MemberProfile">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.MemberProfile</see> to get the IStructureSystemMemberProfile object for each structure member. Complete the structure system edit by calling <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.GetFeature">IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData.GetFeature</see> , calling methods and properties on objects retrieved in previous steps as required, and finally calling <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature.ModifyDefinition</see> . Use the examples as models to create and edit structure sytems in your own applications. For more information, read the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System topics.

Type.Name: IStructureSystemMemberFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a structure system member.
Type.Remarks: Remarks This interface is the superclass of <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IPrimaryStructuralMemberFeatureData">IPrimaryStructuralMemberFeatureData</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData">ISecondaryStructuralMemberFeatureData</see> . See the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IStructureSystemFolder">IStructureSystemFolder</see> Remarks. For more information about structure system members, see the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help > Weldments and Structure System > Structure System > Primary Member PropertyManager and Secondary Member PropertyManager topics.

Type.Name: ISurfaceParameterizationData
Type.Description: Allows access to the parameterization data of a surface.
Type.Remarks: Remarks If a surface is periodic in one direction (cylinder, cone, torus, sphere), then U is the periodic direction. The -10000 to 10000 parameter range is the modeling limit for the modeler. This means that the values are effectively infinite in size. To get the parameter range from a given face, use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFace2.GetBox">IFace2.GetBox</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFace2.IGetBox">IFace2.IGetBox</see> , <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISurface.GetClosestPointOn">ISurface.GetClosestPointOn</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISurface.IGetClosestPointOn">ISurface.IGetClosestPointOn</see> , and <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISurface.ReverseEvaluate">ISurface.ReverseEvaluate</see> or <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISurface.IReverseEvaluate">ISurface.IReverseEvaluate</see> . These methods provide a true parameter range that the face is using on the surface.

Type.Name: ISwAddin
Type.Description: Allows applications to create SOLIDWORKS add-ins.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see> . If you are creating a COM-style addin and are using an MFC CCmdTarget-derived object to implement ISwAddin, you must fully implement ITypeInfo as follows: In the declaration of your CCmdTarget-derived class, add: DECLARE_OLETYPELIB() __declspec( dllexport ) virtual BOOL GetDispatchIID(IID* pIID);

Type.Name: ISwAddinAdvancedOptionBroker
Type.Description: Allows add-ins to remove dismissed messages from Tools > Options > System Options > Messages/Errors/Warnings .
Type.Remarks: Remarks To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see> . See the System Options - Messages/Errors/Warnings topic in SOLIDWORKS help for more information about dismissed messages.

Type.Name: ISwAddinBroker
Type.Description: Gets information about an add-in's entities so that SOLIDWORKS can interact with those entities.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see> .

Type.Name: ISwCalloutHandler
Type.Description: Must be implemented by an add-in application to create callouts .
Type.Remarks: Remarks To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see> .

Type.Name: ISwColorContour1
Type.Description: Allows access to the color and display values of curvature in a SOLIDWORKS model.
Type.Remarks: Remarks When implemented, the methods of this interface allow you to assign colors and display values of curvature in a SOLIDWORKS model. To use ISwColorContour1: Implement the ISwColorContour1 interface in an add-in class. Install the implemented interface in the SOLIDWORKS software using <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.InstallModelColorizer">IModelDocExtension.InstallModelColorizer</see> . Run the add-in and open a model document in SOLIDWORKS. In SOLIDWORKS select View > Display > Curvature. The model is colorized by the implemented interface. When you finalize the application, remove the implemented interface from the SOLIDWORKS software using <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.RemoveModelColorizer">IModelDocExtension.RemoveModelColorizer</see> . NOTE: Only one color and display interface can be active at any one time. The last color and display interface installed is the active one. If you remove that color and display interface, then the color and display interface installed before it becomes the active color and display interface. This interface overrides the color and display functionality of the SOLIDWORKS Curvature tool. See SOLIDWORKS Help for details about the SOLIDWORKS Curvature tool. To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see> .

Type.Name: ISwComFeature
Type.Description: Allows applications to create macro features using COM.
Type.Remarks: Remarks See <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/Macro_Features/Exposed_COM_DLL_or_Executable">Exposed COM DLL or Executable and Macro Features</see> and <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/Macro_Features/Overview_of_Macro_Features">Overview of Macro Features</see> for more information. To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see> .

Type.Name: ISwHtmlInterface
Type.Description: Must be implemented in each add-in's Quick Tips HTML page so that users can interact with the add-in's Quick Tips and see associated Bubble ToolTips.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To access this API, include the following line of code in your application. See <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/Overview/Quick_Tips_and_Bubble_ToolTips">Quick Tips and Bubble ToolTips</see> for more information. CreateObject('SwHtmlControl.SwHtmlInterface')

Type.Name: ISwManipulatorHandler2
Type.Description: Must be implemented by an add-in application to interact with a manipulator .

Example.Name: Insert and Use Plane with Manipulator
Insert and Use Plane with Manipulator
Insert and Use Plane with Manipulator

Type.Remarks: Remarks To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see> . The add-in application performs such actions as: Defining how a manipulator moves. For example, the add-in application has the manipulator follow a surface in order to place an image on that surface. Providing any temporary graphics associated with manipulator. For example, to display a temporary body in a part, the add-in application must call <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IBody2.Display3">IBody2.Display3</see> . Applying transforms using <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IBody2.ApplyTransform">IBody2.ApplyTransform</see> . To create a manipulator, first create the SwManipulatorHandler2 object and then create the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IManipulator">IManipulator</see> object. See <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Manipulators">Manipulators</see> for details.

Type.Name: ISwOLEObject
Type.Description: Allows access to an OLE object.

Type.Name: ISwPEClassFactory
Type.Description: Allows access to the callback object used by ISwPEManager to send a license key back to SOLIDWORKS for SOLIDWORKS Partner entitlement verification.
Type.Remarks: Remarks This interface provides a callback mechanism in which: SOLIDWORKS requests the partner's key through the add-in by calling <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swpublished.ISwPEManager.IdentifyToSW">ISwPEManager.IdentifyToSW</see> , The partner add-in sends a license key back to SOLIDWORKS in <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISwPEClassFactory.SetPartnerKey">ISwPEClassFactory.SetPartnerKey</see> , and SOLIDWORKS uses the license key to verify the entitlement of the SOLIDWORKS Partner and returns <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISwPEToken">ISwPEToken</see> . See <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/GettingStarted/SolidWorks_Partner_Program_2">SOLIDWORKS Partner Program</see> .

Type.Name: ISwPEManager
Type.Description: Allows SOLIDWORKS Partners to create SOLIDWORKS add-ins that have been registered with the SOLIDWORKS Partner Program team.
Type.Remarks: Remarks This interface and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.swpublished.ISwAddin">ISwAddin</see> are implemented in add-ins of SOLIDWORKS Partners who participate in the <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/GettingStarted/SolidWorks_Partner_Program_2">SOLIDWORKS Partner Program</see> .

Type.Name: ISwPEToken
Type.Description: * For future use*

Type.Name: ISwQuickTip

Type.Remarks: Remarks See <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Quick_Tips_and_Bubble_ToolTips">Quick Tips and Bubble ToolTips</see> for details. To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see> .

Type.Name: ISwScene
Type.Description: Allows access to the scene of a model.
Type.Remarks: Remarks Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelView.GraphicsRedraw">IModelView.GraphicsRedraw</see> to repaint the graphics area after changing any scene.

Type.Name: ISwUndoAPIHandler
Type.Description: Undo an add-in application's previously processed commands.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To use this interface in a SOLIDWORKS VB.NET or C# macro or add-in, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/ComVisibleAttribute_in_VSTA_macros">ComVisibleAttribute in VB.NET and C# Macros and Add-ins</see> .

Type.Name: ISweepFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a sweep feature.

Example.Name: Insert Swept-cut Feature Using Sketch Profile
Insert Swept-cut Feature Using Circular Profile
Insert Swept-cut Feature Using Tool Body
Insert Swept-cut Feature with Bidirectional Twist

Type.Remarks: Remarks To create a sweep feature, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Sweep_Features_and_SweepFeatureData_Objects">Sweep Features and SweepFeatureData Objects</see> .

Type.Name: ISweptFlangeFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a sheet metal swept flange feature.
Type.Remarks: Remarks For more information about swept flanges, read the SOLIDWORKS Help > Sheet Metal > Using Sheet Metal Tools > Swept Flange > Swept Flange PropertyManager topic.

Type.Name: ISymmetricMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to symmetry mate feature data.
Type.Remarks: Remarks Symmetry mates force two similar entities to be symmetric about a plane or planar face. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this advanced mate interface. To create a symmetry mate: Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISymmetricMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">ISymmetricMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities using Mark = 1. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ISymmetricMateFeatureData.SymmetryPlane">ISymmetricMateFeatureData.SymmetryPlane</see> or use IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2 to pre-select the symmetry plane using Mark = 4. Specify other properties of the SymmetricMateFeatureData object as required. To edit a symmetry mate: Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature.GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a SymmetricMateFeatureData object. Modify the SymmetricMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature.ModifyDefinition</see> . To delete a symmetry mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2</see> .

Type.Name: ITabAndSlotFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a tab and slot feature.

Type.Name: ITabAndSlotGroupData
Type.Description: Allows access to a tab and slot feature group.

Type.Name: ITableAnchor
Type.Description: Allows access to the data that defines a table anchor feature.

Example.Name: Get and Set Table Anchor of Hole Table
Get and Set Table Anchor of Hole Table
Get and Set Table Anchor of Hole Table

Type.Remarks: Remarks If a table anchor is selected, then it can be retrieved with <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISelectionMgr.GetSelectedObject6">ISelectionMgr.GetSelectedObject6</see> . If the selected object type is swSelBOMTEMPS, then getting the selected object is a <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFeature">IFeature</see> object. Use <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetSpecificFeature2">IFeature.GetSpecifiedFeature2</see> to return a TableAnchor object. If you traverse the features and subfeatures of a drawing, then the table anchors display as subfeatures of the sheet format. When <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetTypeName">IFeature.GetTypeName</see> returns GeneralTableAnchor, HoleTableAnchor, WeldmentCutListAnchor, RevisionTableAnchor, or BomTemplate, use IFeature::GetSpecificFeature2 to return a ITableAnchor object. NOTE: Weld table anchors are not currently supported. You can also retrieve a ITableAnchor object from the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISheet">ISheet</see> object using <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks.ISheet.TableAnchor">ISheet.TableAnchor</see> . There is only one anchor of each type on a sheet format.

Type.Name: ITableAnnotation
Type.Description: Provides access to table annotations.

Example.Name: Hide or Show First Column in Hole Table
Hide or Show First Column in Hole Table
Hide or Show First Column in Hole Table
Get Components in Each BOM Table Row
Get Components in Each BOM Table Row
Get Components in Each BOM Table Row

Type.Remarks: Remarks See <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.swconst.swTableAnnotationType_e">swTableAnnotationType_e</see> for the types of tables derived from ITableAnnotation.

Type.Name: ITablePatternFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a table-driven pattern feature.

Example.Name: Get Points of Repeating Elements in Table-driven Pattern
Get Points of Repeating Elements in Table-driven Pattern
Get Points of Repeating Elements in Table-driven Pattern

Type.Remarks: Remarks Read <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Pattern_Features_and_their_Feature_Data_Objects">Pattern Features and their Feature Data Objects</see> . Before calling IFeatureManager::CreateDefinition, you must pre-select the entities needed to create the table-driven pattern feature. To select ... Use mark... Seed feature 4 Coordinate system 16 Reference point 32 Seed face 128 Seed body 256 You must call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.CreateFeature">IFeatureManager.CreateFeature</see> after initializing this feature data object in order to successfully create the table-driven pattern. See the Table Driven Patterns topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help for more information about table-driven patterns.

Type.Name: ITangentMateFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a tangent mate feature.
Type.Remarks: Remarks A tangent mate: Places selected items tangent to one another. Must have at least one cylindrical, conical, or spherical item. <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMateFeatureData">IMateFeatureData</see> is the parent of this mate interface. To create a tangent mate: Follow general instructions in the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate">IAssemblyDoc.CreateMate</see> Remarks. Specify <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.ITangentMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate">ITangentMateFeatureData.EntitiesToMate</see> or use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2">IModelDocExtension.SelectByID2</see> to pre-select the entities to mate using Mark = 1. Specify other properties of the TangentMateFeatureData object. To edit a tangent mate: Access its feature and call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.GetDefinition">IFeature.GetDefinition</see> to get the MateFeatureData object. Cast the MateFeatureData object to a TangentMateFeatureData object. Modify the TangentMateFeatureData object. Call <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeature.ModifyDefinition">IFeature.ModifyDefinition</see> . To delete this tangent mate, use <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2">IModelDocExtension.DeleteSelection2</see> .

Type.Name: ITaperedTapElementData
Type.Description: Allows access to the data of a tapered tap hole element in an Advanced Hole.
Type.Remarks: Remarks To create an Advanced Hole feature, see the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IFeatureManager.AdvancedHole">IFeatureManager.AdvancedHole</see> Remarks.

Type.Name: ITaskpaneView
Type.Description: Provides access to an application-level Task Pane.

Add .NET Controls to SOLIDWORKS using an Add-in

Type.Remarks: Remarks Events are implemented with delegates in the Microsoft .NET Framework. See the <see cref="SOLIDWORKS.Interop.sldworks_namespace">Overview</see> topic for a list of delegates for this interface.

Type.Name: ITessellation
Type.Description: Used to gather tessellation information from a SOLIDWORKS body.
Type.Remarks: Remarks Allows you to specify certain tolerances to adjust the information that is returned that describes the tessellation of this body.

Type.Name: ITextAndCustomProperty
Type.Description: Gains access to the text and custom properties in a theme of a SOLIDWORKS MBD 3D PDF .

Example.Name: Publish Text and Custom Properties from Theme to MBD 3D PDF
Publish Text and Custom Properties from Theme to MBD 3D PDF
Publish Text and Custom Properties from Theme to MBD 3D PDF

Type.Remarks: Remarks SOLIDWORKS Model Based Definition (MBD) is an integrated drawingless manufacturing solution for SOLIDWORKS. Typical steps for generating a SOLIDWORKS MBD 3D PDF using the SOLIDWORKS API are: Get the <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData">MBD3DPdfData object</see> using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IModelDocExtension.GetMBD3DPdfData">IModelDocExtension.GetMBD3DPdfData</see> . Set the path and file name of the SOLIDWORKS MBD 3D PDF theme using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.ThemeName">IMBD3DPdfData.ThemeName</see> . Get standard and custom views using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.GetStandardViews">IMBD3DPdfData.GetStandardViews</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.GetMoreViews">IMBD3DPdfData.GetMoreViews</see> . Set standard and custom views using <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.SetStandardViews">IMBD3DPdfData.SetStandardViews</see> and <see cref="SolidWorks.Interop.sldworks.IMBD3DPdfData.SetMoreViews">IMBD3DPdfData.SetMoreViews</see> . Get and set text and custom properties in the theme using the array of objects returned by this interface's accessor. See the

Type.Name: IThickenFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a thicken feature.

Type.Name: IThreadFeatureData
Type.Description: Allows access to a thread feature.
Type.Remarks: Remarks This interface: Accesses the feature data for a thread created either inside a cylindrical hole or around a cylindrical rod. Is functionally similar to the Thread PropertyManager in the SOLIDWORKS Design user interface. To create a Thread feature, see <see cref="../sldworksapiprogguide/OVERVIEW/Thread_Features_and_ThreadFeatureData_Objects">Thread Features and ThreadFeatureData Objects</see> . For more information, see the Thread PropertyManager topic in the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface help.

Type.Description: Allows access to the title block in this sheet.
